https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

The measurement and modelling of the elevation of geographic locations, i.e. of the height above or below a fixed reference point, most commonly a reference geoid (a mathematical model of the Earth's sea level as an equipotential gravitational surface).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The science of measuring and representing the geometry (size and shape) of the Earth and the precise location of points on its surface; it includes the determination of the gravitational field of the Earth and the study of temporal variations such as Earth tides, polar motion, and rotation of the Earth.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: From the Fields of Research vocabulary from the Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification (ANZSRC, 2020). Definition adapted from Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et al., 2011) and Wikipedia.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The science of measuring and representing the geometry (size and shape) of the Earth and the precise location of points on its surface; it includes the determination of the gravitational field of the Earth and the study of temporal variations such as Earth tides, polar motion, and rotation of the Earth.
